We are bringing SAP Business AI to the next level via Joule Agents, that can autonomously plan and execute multi-step workflows.

Why do I include this in a section on user experience updates? Aren‚Äôt Joule Agents a back-end thing? Well‚Ä¶ the reason is simple: Joule Agents significantly enhance the overall user experience, as opposed to the user interface, because the system will do a lot more for you based on your requests. This means that the overall experience you have using SAP goes up a level, since you can get a lot done much more easily than before.

Joule Agents can be triggered from Joule directly, or embedded within applications. These four marketing videos show you examples of agents available today:

  • Finance: Dispute Resolution Agent (1:38 minutes)
  • Procurement: Sourcing Agent (1:48 minutes)
  • Sales and services: Account Planning Agent (1:24 minutes)
  • Human Resources: Performance and Goals Agent (1:34 minutes)

This example for customer service agents goes into more detail:

  • CX Agents (in SAP Discovery Center).

For a general overview of Joule Agents, have a look here:

  • Joule Agents on sap.com.
  • AI Agents in Action (blog post).
  • Envision the Future of Generative AI with SAP's AI Agents (blog post).
  • How SAP‚Äôs AI Agent Architecture Enables Unprecedented Automation and Decision Augmentation (blog post by Philipp Herzig).

Product-specific capabilities

In addition to the above generic capabilities, our products provide a large number of Joule skills for getting your work done more efficiently, as well as a handful of the new agents discussed above. For a comprehensive overview of Joule capabilities, including product-specific skills available today, here‚Äôs where to go:

  • Joule Capabilities (a 484 page (!) PDF document from July 11th, 2025, including a list of What‚Äôs New)
  • Joule Capabilities (online documentation)

Customer-specific Joule skills

You can now build your own Joule skills using Joule Studio, which has now been made generally available. Read Michael Ameling‚Äôs overview blog post:

  • Joule Studio is generally available in SAP Build: Empower your business with intelligent automation

Joule on Mobile Devices ‚Äì now for SAP SuccessFactors too

Joule has been available via SAP Mobile Start since Q1/2025 (as announced in this blog post), and is now also available directly from within the SAP SuccessFactors mobile app, supporting these three patterns:

  • Transactional: Joule can handle tasks like requesting time off, updating contact information, and even deleting phone numbers, directly within the chat interface.
  • Navigational: Joule can guide users to specific pages within the app based on their requests, such as directing them to where they can assign team goals.
  • Informational: Joule can access documentation and knowledge bases to answer questions about company policies, HR guidelines, and other relevant information, providing summaries and links to related resources.

Figure 5 shows two examples of the transactional pattern plus one example of the informational pattern (‚ÄúCan I use my private car for my business trip?‚Äù).

 

Figure 5: Examples of Joule on the SuccessFactors Mobile App. Alt Text: The image shows three examples: The first shows the response to the request by a manager ‚ÄúView time off approval‚Äù, with the details of one request, including the employee's name, the time-off period, and the type of time-off (vacation). The user can view the details, approve, or decline the request. The second screen shows a conversation where the user asks if they can use their private car for a business trip, and the system responds that they can, providing details on the reimbursement policy. The third screen shows the user requesting one day of vacation leave on March 3, 2025. The system confirms the request and provides the details of the leave, including the start and end times, and the date the user will return to work.

Find out more here:

  • Say Hi to Joule in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile, Powered by SAP Build - Part 1: Unlocking AI for HR)
  • Joule in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile: Getting Things Done with AI...
  • Documentation: Joule Available in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile - May 2025

Further information on Joule

If you want an overview of what‚Äôs new, or want to set up Joule in your landscape, have a look at the documentation:

  • Joule documentation (including What‚Äôs New, What is Joule?, integration guide)
  • What is Joule? PDF file

For an overview of what is planned, have a look at the road map for Joule in the SAP Road Map Explorer:

  • Joule Road Map.

 

SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone users and administrators benefit from these recent innovations:

  • New Side navigation for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.
  • SAPUI5 version preview.
  • Mobile Start supports Work Zone, advanced edition.

New Side Navigation

As I announced in April, in my blog post Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web), we are introducing some design updates to all our products in the SAP Business Suite to further increase consistency, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products ‚Äì no unexpected surprises. One of these is the introduction of a navigation menu on the left side of the screen.

SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, is the first product to support this new design. Figure 6 shows what it looks like when the navigation menu is expanded, while Figure 7 shows it collapsed.

Figure 6: Side navigation expanded for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition. Alt Text: A screen showing a SAP Build Work Zone screen with a navigation menu on the left with four entries ‚ÄúCentral Procurement‚Äù, ‚ÄúGlobal Support‚Äù, ‚ÄúMy IT Experience‚Äù (selected), and ‚ÄúSelf Services‚Äù. On the right various cards are shown in a section ‚ÄúEmployee Information‚Äù.

 

Figure 7: Side navigation collapsed for SAP Work Zone, standard edition. Alt Text: similar to Figure 6, but with the navigation menu on the left collapsed to the width of an icon, with four icons shown representing the four navigation options.

SAPUI5 Version Preview

We have introduced a new feature that allows administrators to preview upcoming SAPUI5 versions in non-productive environments within SAP Build Work Zone, two weeks before they are adopted in the productive environment.  Until now, the latest SAPUI5 versions were automatically adopted in production environments, which limited opportunities for early evaluation ahead of deployment.

By enabling the preview setting on specific non-productive sites, administrators can assess compatibility and performance with the upcoming version. This controlled testing environment helps identify and address potential issues, reducing the likelihood of disruptions in production. After the two-week preview period, the RTC version becomes the default, aligning all sites with the latest stable release.

When looking at the sites in the site directory, those sites for which the preview is switched on are indicated clearly, as shown in Figure X.

Figure 8: Site directory with a site where preview is turned on. Alt Text: the image shows a card from the site directory for a site called ‚ÄúPreview SAPUI5 Demo‚Äù with a green badge containing the text ‚ÄúSAPUI5 Preview Enabled‚Äù.

Read more about this feature in this blog post:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

SAP Mobile Start Supports SAP Work Zone, Advanced Edition

When using SAP Mobile Start with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, you can now access your Workspaces or Feed Updates. As with the standard edition, your native and web apps are available within the Apps Screen of SAP Mobile Start, as well as in your Favorites Section on the Start Screen, based on your individual selection. 

Tasks and Notifications from SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, are also integrated into SAP Mobile Start: they are shown next to your business tasks and situations in the To-Do sections and in the Notification Center. Figure 9 shows an example with notifications from the advanced edition.

This integration is automatically available to customers with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition or SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone if the SAP Mobile Start toggle is enabled in the Site Manager.

Figure 9: SAP Mobile Start notification center with notifications from SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. Alt Text: A list of two notifications: ‚ÄúLeave Request‚Äù, with a red text ‚ÄúImportant‚Äù and ‚Äú2 weeks ago‚Äù, and ‚ÄúInvite to Worskpace‚Äù, with text ‚ÄúMustaq Ahmmed has invited you to join the workspace ‚ÄúHelp & Support Workspace‚Äù and ‚Äú2 weeks ago‚Äù.

 

Note that SAP Mobile Start is not the successor app for the SAP Build Work Zone Advanced mobile app. Find out more here:

  • Support of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced and much more: SAP Mobile Start V2.2 & 2.3 - Release Update.

 

SAP Mobile Start

Updated August 13th with information about the 2.4 release.

Beyond providing Joule natively for mobile devices, SAP Mobile Start has recently introduced a number of user experience improvements with their 2.2 and 2.3 releases. In addition to supporting SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, as described above, the main new features are:

  • Completed To-Dos are now displayed too (see Figure 10).
  • Site Switch allows you to directly switch between SAP Build Work Zone sites, without having to go through the onboarding process for each site.
  • The news tile can now also include images (see Figure 10).
  • News feeds that require authentication are supported now.
  • Design updates such as enhanced navigation bar for Apple iPad and a new fresher design for monitoring details on Apple Watch.
  • SAP Document AI integration.
  • Onboarding via deep links.
  • Top news, which gets shown prominently on the start screen.
  • Additional text with sensitive content can now be shown in notifications.

Figure 10: On the left, SAP Mobile Start showing completed To-Dos, on the right showing news with an image. Alt Text: On the left, the To-Dos section is selected, showing two To-Do cards, and the top half of a third card. The first one shows Maria Smith requested 180 days maternity leave, the second one that Quality Manager Donna Moore requested ‚Ç¨47,600 spend. The right shows the start page, with a section Monitoring apps at the top, with two cards, followed by the News section, with one card listing two news items, the first of which has an image.

To find out more about the above recent innovations as well as what is planned in our road map, have a look at:

  • Support of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced and much more: SAP Mobile Start V2.2 & 2.3 - Release Update.
  • SAP Mobile Start V2.4: SAP Document AI integration and much more. Release Update.
  • SAP Mobile Start Road Map.

Continue Reading

I hope you enjoyed this first part, covering cross-product UX services. Here's a link to part 2, covering a large number of UX innovations which are generally available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori launchpad:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Destination Error in UI Integration Card while accessing from SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi All,

Writing this blog after solving my issue which I got unexpected.

Requirement:

I developed one UI Integration Card in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) and I was able to the Preview of the card in the BAS which is getting data based on Standard OData services from S/4HANA.

After that I Packaged the UI Integration Card in Content Package and imported in the SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition and I was able to access the card in my site. 

 

Error Details:

But suddenly effective from 25th July 2025, I got the below Error (PFA the error for same):

Destination "ecqrtcard" could not be resolved.

No technical destination found. Content Channel ID: "ovps". Please contact your administrator.

It is because of SAP did some update in Standard Destination Configuration in BTP because earlier to 25ht July my card was working without error.

I raised the question in the community, but no one replied there, below is the link for my question where I only answered to my question:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/ui-integration-card-error-while-accessing-in-sap-build-work-zone-standard/qaq-p/14162532#M4921009

 

Solution:

After reading lot of blogs, I was not able to find the solution then raised with SAP Support. They replied back with the following document:

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/map-card-aliases-to-destinations

So here is the solution of the issue. We need to configure the Alias in the Content Package configuration in the Work Zone, PFA the below Screen shot of the configuration:

1 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

3 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

4 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

5 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

After this configuration we need to refresh the site, it will work (PFA the Screen shot "UI Card Access in BWZ, Standard Edition".

 

Hope this will help community to fix the issue.

 

Summary:

We need to get the alert from SAP if they are doing any patch update in the BTP service and same reply I got over the Incident from SAP Team. After every patch we need to do end to end testing of our application to avoid any issue.

 

Conclusion:

So the final conclusion is that We need to map the aliases in each and every content package which we are creating in the Build Work Zone and need to test the application if we get any alert from SAP Team for patch update in SAP BTP Services.

 

Thanks.

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: New in SAP Mobile Start V2.4: Integrate and Launch SAP Document AI on Mobile
entry.content:
With the SAP Mobile Start‚ÄØ2.4 release, users can leverage SAP Document‚ÄØAI‚Äîintegrated seamlessly within the Mobile Start app‚Äîto transform document handling into a secure, intelligent, and automated experience. They can scan or upload documents directly from SAP Mobile Start, which are then processed by the SAP Document AI service. This streamlines processing, cuts down manual work, and boosts data accuracy throughout your operations. In this blog, I'll walk you through the integration steps, prerequisites, and configuration details needed to bring SAP Document AI capabilities to your mobile users. 

Preconditions 

Before you begin, ensure the following prerequisites are fulfilled. 

Subscribe to SAP Document AI

Ensure that your SAP BTP subaccount is subscribed to the Document Information Extraction service (document-information-extraction-application-ias with embedded_edition instance). Once complete, access the SAP Document AI workspace from your BTP subscriptions to configure document types and schemas relevant to your business scenarios. For more information, refer to the official user guide. 

Enable Identity Authentication for SAP Build Work Zone

In SAP Build Work Zone, navigate to Site Manager > Settings, and ensure Identity Authentication is enabled. 

Screenshot: Enabling Identity Authentication in SAP Build Work Zone Settings

Note: Valid only for SAP Build Work Zone subscription made before 20 March 2025.

Configure Trust Relationship for API Access

To allow SAP Build Work Zone to consume SAP Document AI APIs, you need to add a dependency in the SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS) administration console: 

  • Go to the Applications tab 
  • Select the SAP Build Work Zone application 
  • Under Dependencies, add a new entry with: 
  • Name: documentai (or any unique name) 
  • Application: Select the ‚ÄúSAP Document AI‚Äù entry in your IAS tenant 

Create Destination for SAP Mobile Start

To authorize SAP Mobile Start App to access SAP Document AI, create a destination in your BTP subaccount with the following settings: 

  • Name: sapdocumentaimobilestartintegration 
  • Type: HTTP 
  • Authentication: NoAuthentication 
  • Proxy Type: Internet 
  • URL: (Use https://<your-tenant-url-endpoint>/document-ai/v1, located in Document AI instance > service key > endpoints > backend > URL) 

Add the following additional properties: 

  • HTML5.DynamicDestination = true
  • HTML5.IASDependencyName = documentai (dependency name created in SAP Cloud Identity Services) 

Once completed, both‚ÄØSAP Build Work Zone‚ÄØand‚ÄØSAP Mobile Start‚ÄØare authorized to access SAP Document AI. You can control user access in SAP Document AI using default authorization policies via Identity Authentication service. (Learn more)

Configuring tile for SAP Document AI access in mobile 

To make SAP Document AI accessible via SAP Mobile Start: 

Step 1: Create a New App in Site Manager  

In SAP Build Work Zone, navigate to Site Manager > Content Manager and create a new App. 

  • URL: https://<your-tenant-url>/launchpad?sap-ushell-config=headerless#InboundDocument-manageInDocumentAI
    ‚ÑπÔ∏è Use sap-ushell-config=headerless to hide the launchpad header
Step 2: Configure Navigation Parameters 

In the Navigation tab, add the following parameters: 

  • name: Schema name - Optional (from SAP Document AI workspace > Schemas tab) 
  • latest: true, this signifies that only the latest version of the schema is used 
  • client_ID: Client ID (from SAP Document AI workspace > Settings), preset to ‚Äòdefault‚Äô 
  • instance_ID: Instance ID (from SAP Document AI workspace > Settings or BTP account > Instances > Select SAP Document AI instance) 
  • showWorkspaceHeader: true 
Step 3: Configure Visualization 

You can set your own preferred title, subtitle, icon. 

  • Visualisation Type: Static Tile 
  • Add the following name-value parameters:  
  • mobilestart.type: documentAi 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.clientId: (as specified in Navigation Tab parameters) 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.instanceId: (as specified in Navigation Tab parameters) 
  • mobilestart.documentAi.documentSchemaId: Optional - needed if only a specific schema scenario should be enabled, otherwise all active schemas will be shown to the end user. You can find Schema ID in SAP Document AI workspace > Schemas tab 

Screenshot: SAP Document AI Tile Visualization in SAP Build Work Zone

You‚Äôve now created a fully functional SAP Document AI tile for SAP Mobile Start! üöÄ 

User Experience in SAP Mobile Start 

As a business user, you can locate the newly created SAP Document AI tile in the SAP Mobile Start app using the Search function. For easier access, you can also add the tile to your Favorites. When you tap the tile, you‚Äôll be directed to a native document selection screen. Depending on how the service was configured by the administrator, you may have the option to select a document type and schema. If the tile is configured for a specific schema use case, it will be automatically selected. 

Screenshot: SAP Document AI tile in SAP Mobile Start App 

Upload Options 

  1. Scan via Camera ‚Äì Leverages the device‚Äôs native camera with real-time preview, cropping, rotation, and filtering. Multiple scans are compiled into a single PDF. 
  2. Select Images from Gallery ‚Äì Users choose previously captured images which are compiled into a single PDF. 
  3. Select File from File Explorer ‚Äì Users upload a single PDF from their device‚Äôs file system. 

 Screenshot: Scanning a document via device‚Äôs native camera  

Upload Validation & Handling 

Before uploading a document, the app performs several validation checks to ensure compatibility. The file size must not exceed 50 MB, and the document should contain no more than 100 pages. Additionally, file names are automatically sanitized to remove any invalid characters. Once these checks are successfully passed, the upload process begins, with a visible progress bar indicating status. Android users can upload multiple documents synchronously.  

After the upload is complete, the document extraction workflow is triggered, and users receive a success notification confirming the process. 

Track Status and Review Document 

To monitor the progress of document extraction, simply open the Document Overview from the overflow menu within the document selection screen. This action launches the mobile-optimized SAP Document AI UI, providing a clear and intuitive view of the status, allowing reviews and other updates related to your uploaded documents. 

Screenshot: Track status and review document via mobile optimized UI 

Conclusion 

With the release of SAP Mobile Start 2.4 and the seamless integration of SAP Document AI, business users now benefit from a truly mobile-first, intelligent document processing experience. Whether it's capturing receipts on the go, processing invoices, or extracting data from complex forms, SAP Document AI empowers users to automate workflows efficiently‚Äîright from their mobile devices. This integration brings the power of AI-driven document handling directly to your fingertips, enabling smarter, faster, and more scalable business operations.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs dynamic business environment, where speed and precision are critical to success, the ability to access, create, and act on information quickly has become a competitive advantage. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to introduce the latest AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. They are designed to help your organization unlock greater productivity and smarter collaboration.  

With the addition of AI-based text generation, summarization, and comment generation, you can now accelerate content creation, quickly distill key insights from lengthy documents, and actively engage with workspace content, all directly within your digital workplace. 

As SAP Build Work Zone continues to evolve into an intelligent digital workspace, these new features bring built-in intelligence that reduces manual effort, accelerates decision-making, and enhances the overall employee experience.  

 

AI promotional model 

To help you explore these new capabilities, we‚Äôre offering them under a promotional model (totally free of charge) until December 31, 2025. During this period, each global account is entitled to 100,000 AI requests per calendar month across all instances of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If the monthly quota is exceeded, users will receive a notification. The quota resets at the start of each month. 

After the promotional period ends, AI features will be available under a commercial model of SAP AI core. If you choose not to activate the commercial offering, the features will be automatically disabled. 

 

Availability 

The AI capabilities are powered by SAP AI Core and are available in the following data centers: 

  • AWS: Australia (Sydney), Brazil (S√£o Paulo), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt EU Access), Japan (Tokyo), Singapore, US East (VA) 
  • Microsoft Azure: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Netherlands), US East (VA) 
  • Google Cloud: Australia Southeast (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), India (Mumbai), KSA (Dammam ‚Äì KSA Regulated Customers), US Central (IA) 

 

Enabling the AI features  

These AI-powered features can be enabled in the admin console. To get started, follow these simple steps: 

Step 1: Submit a Support Ticket 

Open a support ticket on component LOD-SF-SWZ requesting AI enablement for your subaccount. Make sure to include your environment details, which you can copy from the Admin Console > Overview screen using the Copy Info button. 

Step 2: Enable AI in the Admin Console 

Navigate to Administration Console > Feature Enablement > Features. Here you can select the AI features you want to activate. You‚Äôll be prompted to review and accept the terms and conditions before proceeding. 

 

Explore the new AI features 

Once enabled using the steps above, you‚Äôll find these capabilities integrated seamlessly into your workpages and workspace tools.  

1. AI Summarization 

This feature allows you to get the gist of long documents within seconds. AI Summarization helps you to condense large chunks of content such as wikis, blogs, workpages, and documents, into concise summaries.  

To summarize a content item, navigate to the workspace‚Äôs Content list from the navigation bar and select the document you want to process. When the content is open, click the Summarize button located at the top of the screen.  

The AI will then generate a summary that captures the key points of the original text.  

This feature supports content up to 100K words, making it a perfect tool for quickly grasping the essentials without having to read through long texts. 

2. AI Text Generation 

With this feature you can create compelling content with a few simple prompts. This feature helps you generate contextual text directly within your workpages. It is great for drafting introductions, elaborating ideas, or kickstarting any type of content. 

To use it, simply click on Add within a cell in your workspace and choose Generate Text from the dropdown menu.  

 

A dialog box will appear where you can enter your prompt. 

Based on this input, AI will generate relevant text, which may take a few moments to appear. Once the text is generated, you can further fine-tune the content to suit your style and requirements. Once you are satisfied you have the option to accept it, discard it, or generate a new version.  

3. AI Comment Generation 

Using this feature you can respond intelligently with AI-suggested comments. AI Comment Generation simplifies the process of engaging with content through contextual comments.  

To put this feature, open the Content list and select the specific content item you‚Äôd like to respond to. At the bottom of the screen, the AI icon can help you generate text with AI.  

Here you can enter a prompt or context.  

AI will then suggest relevant comment options for you to accept, discard or retry.

You can use this feature to contribute to discussions, provide feedback, or interact with colleagues. The same text generation experience is available when writing a news feed as well.

***** 

These AI-powered enhancements are just the beginning. At SAP, we're committed to helping you work more intelligently, engage more effectively, and innovate faster. Stay tuned as we continue to expand the AI capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, empowering your teams like never before. 

 

Learn more: 

‚û§ SAP Build Work Zone on: sap.com / SAP Community

‚û§ SAP Application Development and Automation Community Group

‚û§ Joule is available in SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition

entry.title: Steps to fix the X-Frame-Options error to integrate a CAP application into Build workzone Launchpad
entry.content:
When attempting to configure a CAP application within the SAP Build Workzone launchpad service, you might encounter the following errors:
  1. "Refused to display 'XXX' in a frame because it set 'X - Frame - Options' to 'sameorigin'."
  2. "Embedding blocked because the allowlist or the allowlist service is not configured correctly - sap/ui/security/FrameOptions."
 
Here are the steps to resolve these issues:
 
Step 1: Modify the index.html file of the UI app
Insert the following lines:
<meta name="sap.whitelistService" content="./whitelist/service" />
data - sap - ui - frame - options="trusted"
 
Step 2: Configure the whitelist endpoint in xs-app.json
Add the following block:
"whitelistService": {
    "endpoint": "/whitelist/service"
}
 
Step 3: Set the CF environment variable CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST using the CF command
Run the following command, replacing <YOUR_CAP_APP> with the actual name of your CAP application:
cf set - env <YOUR_CAP_APP> CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST '[{"host":"*.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com"}]'
 
This should help in successfully integrating the CAP application into the SAP Build Workzone Launchpad and resolving the X - Frame - Options error.

entry.title: üü° Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt üî®ü™ô ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues from several missions, described in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as values for ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‚Äå

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Hunt

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample hunt (just a warm-up, no points will be earned). Each mission is independent of the other.

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

You can also see the hex digits in the description.

26SAP Community

Inside this blog post, use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the cell immediately to the left (in this very table) and find the 6-digit RGB ASCII code for the color of the text. 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits (13 in all), in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

üëâIn this blog post, post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase). You won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example hunt, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) hunt

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

üëâTo be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‚Äå When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Security
entry.content:
I've been spending quite some time recently diving deep into SAP Build Work Zone security, and let me tell you, it's a journey. Terms like #IAS, #BTP Subaccount #trusts, and #ShadowUsers can sometimes feel like a maze.

But then, an analogy clicked for me - the #DigitalMall and suddenly, the whole complex architecture started making perfect sense. I wanted to share this breakdown with all of you, hoping it helps.

Let's imagine SAP Build Work Zone as a bustling, modern Digital Mall, where users (you, the #shoppers) come to access various #stores (business applications) and "services" (collaboration features). Every security layer has a purpose, just like every part of a well run mall

#TheGrandOpening: Understanding this Digital Mall's Foundation

Before anyone even walks in, the mall has a master plan and a way to organize its offerings:

>>> SAP BTP Subaccount: Think of this as the Mall's Main Entrance & Security Gate. It's the primary gateway, controlling who can even step foot inside your digital space. It's where core permissions are managed.

>>> SAP Build Work Zone Tenant: This is your specific, unique instance of the Mall itself - your personalized shopping experience!

>>> #ContentManager: This acts like the Mall's Central Directory or Information Kiosk. It lists all the "stores" (your business applications) available within the mall, helping shoppers find what they need

>>> Content Providers: These are the "Department Stores" (like SAP S/4HANA
SuccessFactors) or even smaller "Boutiques" (your custom applications). They reside outside your immediate mall structure but integrate seamlessly, making their offerings available inside your Work Zone.

>>>>Stepping Inside: Your Identity & Basic Mall Access<<<<

Now, for the really crucial part: how does a "shopper" (your user) actually get into the Digital Mall, and how is their identity validated at the main entrance?

>>> #SAPCloudIdentityServices - Identity Authentication (IAS): The Mall's Central Security System / ID Proxy

This is the mandatory first stop for any user trying to enter your Work Zone mall. #IAS is your primary #IdentityProvider [IDP]

>>> #Proxy Mode: If your organization uses its own Corporate IdP (like Azure AD, Okta), IAS acts as a clever proxy. You authenticate against your corporate system, and IAS then receives that verified identity, federating it onward in a way Work Zone understands. It's seamless, you just show your corporate ID.

>>> #TheDigitalIdCard (SAML Assertion / OIDC Token): Once authenticated, IAS issues a secure token. This token is packed with vital information, essentially your digital "ID Card" that gets you past the main gate:

>>> #SubjectNameIdentifier (SNI): This is your main identifier (e.g., your Login Name or Employee ID). It's what the BTP Subaccount primarily uses.

#Assertion Attribute (often IAS UUID): This is a unique, stable, and persistent ID assigned by IAS. It's super important for internal Work Zone component communication later on, especially with the DWS (our "Community Center," which I'll cover in Part 2!)

---> Other standard user attributes like email, first name, last name.

SAP BTP Subaccount Trust Configuration: The Main Gate's Agreement with IAS

Your BTP Subaccount (the main gate) has a "trust agreement" with IAS. This allows it to confidently accept those digital ID cards (tokens) from IAS.

>>> #The XSUAA Shadow User: Your Mall Access Card. This is one of the most critical concepts

When a user successfully authenticates via IAS for the first time, a "Shadow User" record is either created or identified in the BTP Subaccount's internal user list. Think of this as your personal "Mall Access Card" record.

 

Why is it needed? Even if IAS knows who you are, the BTP Subaccount needs its own local record (the shadow user) to attach BTP Role Collections to it. These role collections are your "Mall-wide Privileges" (e.g., WorkZone_User, WorkZone_Admin) that determine what you can do across the whole Work Zone platform.

 

>>>> Crucial Point: If a shadow user doesn't exist (and automatic creation isn't enabled), login to Work Zone will fail because there is no local identity to attach permissions to.

Principal Propagation: Seamless Access to Department Stores!

Once you're in the mall and launch an app from an On-Premise Backend System (like an S/4HANA Fiori app via SAP Cloud Connector), you don't want to log in again, right?

This is where ##Principal Propagation comes in! Your identity (using the IAS SNI from the BTP trust) is seamlessly passed through the BTP Destination Service and SAP Cloud Connector directly to the backend system. The S/ 4HANA system then recognizes you and authorizes your access based on your roles within S/4HANA. It's like your Mall Access Card automatically opening the staff-only doors in a department store.

This is just the exciting first step of understanding Work Zone security. In Part 2, coming next.

The Digital Workplace Service (DWS) (the Mall's Community Center).

User and User List Provisioning (how the Community Center gets its member lists).

The critical differences between Internal vs. External Users (different types of Community Center members).

And how SCIM APIs are the "automated delivery trucks" for all this data!

Stay tuned for more insights, and in the meantime, I'd love to hear your thoughts or questions on this first part in the comments below!

Happy Work Zone-ing!

Lets connect and learn together ‚úåÔ∏è

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4 Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into three sections:

1. Prerequisites

2.  Connecting with S/4 HANA Data Base.

3.CRUD Operations

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT üòÄ

 

 

 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

 

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

 

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

 

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

 

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

 

 

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

 

Select them and click and assign.

 

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

 

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

 

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

 

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

 

 

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

 

 

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

 

Click Create 

 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

 

 

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) ‚Äî if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                  ÔÇ∑ Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

 

Are you all done!! Lets get into next Episode soon...

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

Hope it‚Äôs helpful üòâ

 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.
